title: Will Google train its AI on your Siri data? Apple breaks silence after Gemini partnership
snippet: Apple has commited that the Siri powered by Gemini will adhere to its privacy standards and the requests made by the users will be processed on device or via its Private Compute Cloud.

title: Apple signs multi-year deal with Google to finally fix Siri with Gemini: Here’s what you need to know
snippet: Apple has signed a multi-year agreement with Google Gemini to power its Apple Intelligence features including a personalized version of Siri which the company promised at WWDC 2024 but has since been delayed.

title: Apple beats Samsung, Xiaomi and Vivo, leading global smartphone shipments in 2025
snippet: Global smartphone shipments rose 2% in 2025, driven by stronger demand in emerging markets, according to Counterpoint Research. Apple led the market ahead of Samsung and Xiaomi, while Vivo gained share and OPPO faced pressure amid regional competition.

title: LEGO announces first official Pokémon building sets for 2026 launch: Get Pikachu, Charizard and more
snippet: The LEGO Group has unveiled its first official Pokémon sets, launching globally on February 27, 2026. The debut range features Pikachu, Eevee, Venusaur, Charizard and Blastoise across three display-focused LEGO builds, with pre-orders now open.

title: UK investigates Musks X over Grok deepfake concerns
snippet: XAI-GROK-BRITAIN:UK investigates Musk's X over Grok deepfake concerns

title: Google Gemini and Search gain agentic commerce tools backed by Flipkart, Wayfair and Target: How shopping will change
snippet: Google has announced new AI-driven shopping tools on Sunday, which includes an open commerce standard, agent-powered checkout in Search and Gemini, branded AI sales agents and a new ad format aimed at simplifying discovery and purchase for online shoppers.

title: iPhone 17 Pro, iPhone 17 Pro Max, iPhone Air prices slashed in Amazon Republic Day Sale 2026
snippet: Amazon India’s Great Republic Day Sale 2026 begins on January 16, offering major discounts on the iPhone 17 Pro, iPhone 17 Pro Max and iPhone Air, along with SBI bank offers, exchange bonuses and deals across electronics.

title: iPhone Face ID not working properly? This Apple's hidden iOS setting could help
snippet: Many iPhone users face unreliable Face ID performance, especially after changes in appearance or viewing angle. A built-in iOS feature called Alternate Appearance allows users to scan their face twice, helping improve recognition accuracy and reduce unlock failures.

title: OnePlus 13, 15, Nord series get MASSIVE discounts: Bank offers, deals and more
snippet: OnePlus has announced its Freedom Sale in India from 16 January 2026, offering temporary price cuts, bank discounts and no-cost EMI across smartphones, tablets and audio products, with select deals and bundles available until 26 January.

title: OnePlus Republic Day Sale announced: OnePlus 15, 15R, Nord 5 prices slashed; check dates and bank offers
snippet: OnePlus Freedom Sale starts on January 16, 2026 with discounts on smartphones, tablets, and audio products. The top deals during the sale include OnePlus15, OnePlus 15R, OnePlus Nord 5, OnePlus Pad 3 and more&nbsp;

OpenAI acquires healthcare startup Torch, deal pegged at $100 million
snippet: Torch is a small healthcare technology startup which focusses on unifying fragmented medical data such as lab results, medications, and doctor visit records, into a single, AI-readable system.

title: OpenAI acquires healthcare startup Torch, deal pegged at $100 million
snippet: Torch is a small healthcare technology startup which focusses on unifying fragmented medical data such as lab results, medications, and doctor visit records, into a single, AI-readable system.

title: Pentagon is embracing Musk's Grok AI chatbot as it draws global outcry
snippet: The announcement comes just days after Grok - which is embedded into X, the social media network owned by Musk - drew global outcry and scrutiny for generating highly sexualized deepfake images of people without their consent.

title: Nvidia says no upfront payment needed for its H200 chips
snippet: The company said it "would never require customers ‌to pay ‌for products they do not receive", in a response ‌to a Reuters story on January 8 about the company having imposed unusually stringent terms requiring full upfront payment from Chinese customers seeking ​its artificial intelligence chips.

title: TCS headcount drops by 11,000 in Q3 after 19,000 in last quarter
snippet: At the end of the December quarter, TCS had 582,163 employees, lower than the September quarter’s count of 593,314, the Mumbai-headquartered firm reported. ​In the previous quarter, the company had reported a net reduction of 19,755 employees, taking its total workforce below six lakh.

title: Meta plans to cut about 10% of employees in reality labs business
snippet: The cuts to Reality Labs -- which has roughly 15,000 employees -- could be announced as soon as Tuesday. The layoffs would be a fraction of Meta's total workforce of 78,000, but are set to disproportionately affect those in the metaverse unit who work on virtual reality headsets and a VR-based socia

title: Instant househelp sector soars; TCS, HCLTech earnings
snippet: Happy Tuesday! India’s on-demand home services sector saw record orders in December. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: India can be global AI use case capital: MeitY Secretary
snippet: India should aim to become the global use case capital for artificial intelligence (AI) if the adoption of the technology is to be spread widely, electronics and information technology secretary S Krishnan said on Monday.

title: HCLTech Q3 PAT dips 11% to Rs 4,076 crore
snippet: HCLTech posted a 3.75% sequential drop in net profit to Rs 4,076 crore, hit by one-time restructuring costs. Revenue exceeded expectations, while AI services grew to $146 million. The company plans to focus on high-growth areas such as AI and semiconductors, maintaining its operating margin guidance

title: TCS Q3 net profit declines 14% to Rs 10,657 crore on labour code rejig hit
snippet: Tata Consultancy Services reported a 14% drop in net profit to Rs 10,657 crore for December 2025, hit by one-time severance and new labour code costs. Revenue grew 5% on-year to Rs 67,087 crore, with AI services showing strong growth. The board approved interim and special dividends.

title: Dina Powell McCormick appointed president and vice-chair at Meta
snippet: Former deputy national security adviser in Donald Trump’s first term served on tech company’s board last year

title: Nvidia and Microsoft back AI breakthrough for gene therapies
snippet: UK’s Basecamp Research uses species genomic sequence database to tackle cancers and superbugs

title: China’s ‘Are You Dead?’ app checks in on growing cohort of people living alone
snippet: Popularity among Chinese Apple users highlights concerns created by rapidly changing demographics

title: Mitigating emissions from air freight: Unlocking the potential of SAF with book and claim
snippet: Emissions from air freight have increased by 25% since 2019, according to a 2024 analysis by environmental advocacy organization Stand.Earth. title: Securing digital assets as crypto crime surges
snippet: In February 2025, cyberattackers thought to be linked to North Korea executed a sophisticated supply chain attack on cryptocurrency exchange Bybit. title: 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2026
Why some “breakthrough” technologies don’t work out
snippet: Every year, MIT Technology Review publishes a list of 10 Breakthrough Technologies. In fact, the 2026 version is out today. This marks the 25th year the newsroom has compiled this annual list, which means its journalists and editors have now identified 250 technologies as breakthroughs.  A few

title: The astronaut training tourists to fly in the world’s first commercial space station
snippet: For decades, space stations have been largely staffed by professional astronauts and operated by a handful of nations. title: Good technology should change the world
snippet: The billionaire investor Peter Thiel (or maybe his ghostwriter) once said, “We were promised flying cars, instead we got 140 characters.” That quip originally appeared in a manifesto for Thiel’s venture fund in 2011. All good investment firms have a manifesto, right? This one argued for making bold

title: Meet the new biologists treating LLMs like aliens
snippet: How large is a large language model? Think about it this way. In the center of San Francisco there’s a hill called Twin Peaks from which you can view nearly the entire city. Picture all of it—every block and intersection, every neighborhood and park, as far as you can see—covered in sheets of paper.

title: How next-generation nuclear reactors break out of the 20th-century blueprint
snippet: Commercial nuclear reactors all work pretty much the same way. Atoms of a radioactive material split, emitting neutrons. Those bump into other atoms, splitting them and causing them to emit more neutrons, which bump into other atoms, continuing the chain reaction.  That reaction gives off heat,
